page.title: 02Changes in the Area
page.content: Up until the Second World War, most farms in the area were almost completely self-sufficient. Specialist occupations such as thatcher or blacksmith were available within this area. Any shopping was done at the local village store as at Ranton rather than in a nearby town such as Stafford. Farm labourers lived in tied cottages, the surrounding land often used for rearing pigs and poultry and growing garden produce. Perks from the farmer might include milk and potatoes A piece of beef or a goose might be provided at Christmas.
